channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Bezos orders deep job cuts at 'Washington Post'
item.description: The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics and national security.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics and national security.

(Image credit: Nicholas Kamm)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Partial government shutdown comes to an end, as negotiations over ICE funding begin
item.description: The partial government shutdown has ended. Now, lawmakers come to a more difficult task: how to find bipartisan agreement on changes to immigration enforcement.
item.content:encoded: The partial government shutdown has ended. Now, lawmakers come to a more difficult task: how to find bipartisan agreement on changes to immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Rep. Rosa DeLauro talks about what's ahead as Congress negotiates DHS funding
item.description: Lawmakers have a little over a week to negotiate changes to federal immigration enforcement. Rep. Rosa DeLauro, D-Conn., talks about what's next and what Democrats are looking to accomplish.
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers have a little over a week to negotiate changes to federal immigration enforcement. Rep. Rosa DeLauro, D-Conn., talks about what's next and what Democrats are looking to accomplish.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: U.K. police investigating Peter Mandelson over Jeffrey Epstein email leak claims
item.description: Peter Mandelson, the United Kingdom's former ambassador to Washington, is being investigated over claims he leaked sensitive government information to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded: Peter Mandelson, the United Kingdom's former ambassador to Washington, is being investigated over claims he leaked sensitive government information to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: A photographer will achieve a milestone record at Super Bowl LX
item.description: When Super bowl 60 gets underway there will be one photographer on the sidelines who has snapped shots at every Super Bowl game. John Biever was 15 when he took photos at the first Super Bowl; he says this one will likely be his last.
item.content:encoded:
When Super bowl 60 gets underway there will be one photographer on the sidelines who has snapped shots at every Super Bowl game. John Biever was 15 when he took photos at the first Super Bowl; he says this one will likely be his last.

(Image credit: Greg Echlin)
item.dc:creator: Greg Echlin

item.title: Ryan Routh, convicted of trying to assassinate Trump, sentenced to life in prison
item.description: A Secret Service agent saw Ryan Routh with a rifle at a golf course in Florida and fired on him in 2024 as Trump was golfing. He was found guilty of attempting to assassinate a presidential candidate.
item.content:encoded:
A Secret Service agent saw Ryan Routh with a rifle at a golf course in Florida and fired on him in 2024 as Trump was golfing. He was found guilty of attempting to assassinate a presidential candidate.

(Image credit: Lothar Speer)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Lawmakers have a little over a week to negotiate changes to federal immigration enforcement, peace talks to end the war in Ukraine resume, Trump says GOP should 'nationalize' elections.
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers have a little over a week to negotiate changes to federal immigration enforcement, peace talks to end the war in Ukraine resume, Trump says GOP should 'nationalize' elections.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: GLP-1 obesity drugs can complicate life for people with disordered eating
item.description: Doctors, patients and researchers are at the very beginning of understanding how the new class of obesity drugs interact with eating disorders.
item.content:encoded:
Doctors, patients and researchers are at the very beginning of understanding how the new class of obesity drugs interact with eating disorders.

(Image credit: Edwin J. Torres for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Jim Henson wanted the Muppets to live on. The show will return for a special reboot
item.description: A one-episode reboot of "The Muppet Show" airs on February 4. Jim Henson, the show's late creator, always hoped they'd live on. We'll hear excerpts from a Morning Edition interview Henson gave in 1986.
item.content:encoded: A one-episode reboot of "The Muppet Show" airs on February 4. Jim Henson, the show's late creator, always hoped they'd live on. We'll hear excerpts from a Morning Edition interview Henson gave in 1986.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Trump's border czar says some ICE agents will leave Minnesota
item.description: About a quarter of the 3,000 federal immigration agents sent to Minnesota will begin to leave today, White House boarder czar Tom Homan announced Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: About a quarter of the 3,000 federal immigration agents sent to Minnesota will begin to leave today, White House boarder czar Tom Homan announced Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Brian Bakst
